title: 112_s2181
content: The Act is titled the "Preparing and Reinvesting in Early Education Act of 2012" or "PRE ED Act of 2012". It expands the FFEL Loan Forgiveness Program to early childhood educators. Section 428J of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include early childhood educators and elementary and secondary school teachers. The Secretary is authorized to carry out a program for loan repayment for teachers who have been employed full-time for 5 consecutive school years in qualifying schools. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include loan forgiveness for teachers who have worked full-time for 5 consecutive school years in qualifying schools. Teachers must meet specific qualifications and not be in default on their loans. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include loan forgiveness for teachers who have worked full-time for 5 consecutive school years in qualifying schools. Teachers must meet specific qualifications and not be in default on their loans. The Secretary will repay up to $5,000 for certain borrowers and up to $25,000 for others after the completion of the fifth year of teaching. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include loan forgiveness for teachers who have worked full-time for 5 consecutive school years in qualifying schools. Borrowers described in subsection (b)(1)(B) may receive up to $25,000 in loan forgiveness. Borrowers cannot receive reductions under both this section and section 460. Subsection (g) is amended to specify the subsections for loan forgiveness eligibility. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include loan forgiveness for teachers who have worked full-time for 5 consecutive school years in qualifying schools, with up to $25,000 in loan forgiveness. Borrowers cannot receive reductions under both this section and section 460. Subsection (g) is amended to specify the subsections for loan forgiveness eligibility, including expanding the federal direct loan cancellation program to early childhood educators. Section 460 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include loan forgiveness for teachers who have worked full-time for 5 consecutive school years in qualifying schools. Borrowers can receive up to $25,000 in loan forgiveness under this program. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to provide loan forgiveness for teachers who have worked full-time for 5 consecutive school years in qualifying schools. Borrowers can receive up to $25,000 in loan forgiveness under this program if they meet certain qualifications, including being highly qualified as defined in the Elementary Secondary Education Act of 1965 or having obtained a degree in early childhood education. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to provide loan forgiveness for teachers who have worked full-time for 5 consecutive school years in qualifying schools. Borrowers can receive up to $25,000 in loan forgiveness under this program if they meet certain qualifications, including not being in default on a loan and completing the fifth complete school year of teaching. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to provide loan forgiveness for teachers who have worked full-time for 5 consecutive school years in qualifying schools. Borrowers can receive up to $25,000 in loan forgiveness under this program if they meet certain qualifications. Borrowers described in subsection (b)(1)(B) are eligible for the forgiveness. Borrowers cannot receive forgiveness under both this section and section 428J. Subsection (g) is amended to specify the eligibility criteria for loan forgiveness. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to provide loan forgiveness for teachers who have worked full-time for 5 consecutive school years in qualifying schools. Section 428K(g)(3)(C) is amended to include "an associate degree in early childhood education or" before "a baccalaureate".
